parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
A primary particle; opposite, i.e. Instead or because of.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Reviling, abuse. From loidoros; slander or vituperation.
A primary particle; opposite, i.e. Instead or because of.
Reviling, abuse. From loidoros; slander or vituperation.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To inherit, obtain (possess) by inheritance, acquire. From kleronomos; to be an heir to.
